messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Absinthe
messages.msgSnippet: ... I don t know if they seve it in pubs. We used to buy it in a bottle. yum Shyrley You laugh at me because I m different. I laugh at you because you are all
messages.messageBody:
On 17 Oct 02, at 9:54, louisam1@... wrote:


>
> When I think of absinthe I think of those paintings by
> Toulouse-Lautrec of people looking completely stoned with a little
> glass of something bright green. I've always thought it was a pretty
> powerful drug and highly addictive.
>
> I went to Google (as Sandra taught me ; )) and it was fascinating.
> Maybe someday I'll visit the UK and try some. Do they serve it in
> pubs there?
>
> Kris
>
I don't know if they seve it in pubs. We used to buy it in a bottle.
yum

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Absinthe
messages.messageBody:
<<And you can't buy absinthe in the stores :-(
I love absinthe. Britian is one of the few countries where it is still
legal.

Shyrley>>

When I think of absinthe I think of those paintings by Toulouse-Lautrec
of people looking completely stoned with a little glass of something
bright green. I've always thought it was a pretty powerful drug and
highly addictive.

I went to Google (as Sandra taught me ; )) and it was fascinating. Maybe
someday I'll visit the UK and try some. Do they serve it in pubs there?

Kris
